title: The Founding of Apple Computer, Inc. - This Month in Business History - Research Guides at Library of Congress
snippet: Apple Computer, Inc. was founded on April 1, 1976, by college dropouts Steve Jobs and Steve Wozniak, who brought to the new company a vision of changing the way people viewed computers.

title: Apple Inc. | History, Products, Headquarters, & Facts | Britannica Money
snippet: When the company expressed no interest, Wozniak teamed up with a former high school classmate, 21-year-old Steve Jobs. The two decided to set up their operations in the Jobs family garage, founding Apple Inc.

title: Today in Apple history: Apple is founded by Steve Jobs, Woz and Ron Wayne
snippet: On April 1, 1976, the Apple Computer Company was founded by Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak and Ronald Wayne to sell the $666 Apple-1 computer.

title: History of Apple Inc. - Wikipedia
snippet: On April 1, 1976, Apple Computer Company was founded by Steve Jobs, Steve Wozniak, and Ronald Wayne. The company was registered as a California business partnership. Wayne, who worked at Atari, Inc. as a chief draftsman, became a co-founder ...
